cards

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • cards.Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CardInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PokerCard

    public abstract class Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements CardInterface
    This class represents a card object that can be applied to most card games that have a suit and rank involved. It has the values of the rank and suit and compares it with those values. The card is the basic playing token for the game. Without this, the game is pretty much un-playable. It is based on the French playing deck.
    Author:
    Jennifer Mackey

      • getSuit

        public Suit getSuit()
        Returns the card's suit value. Suits include the four following: SPADES, DIAMONDS, CLUBS, HEARTS.
        Specified by:

        public int getRank()

        public int compareTo(Card c)
        Compares two cards values, in respect to the rank.
        Parameters:
        other - - the card being compared.
        Returns:
        - 0 if equal, less than 0 if less, greater than 0 if greater.
